intro: Kedrostis brevispinosa, commonly known as the short-spined spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The species is known for its adaptability to arid environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
